1§make a diagnosis from the context: oh my gosh§Disorders due to addictive behaviors are recognized as distinct clinical syndromes that develop from repeated rewarding behaviors other than the use of dependence-producing substances. These disorders may cause significant distress or interfere with personal functions and can involve both online and offline activities
column2: such as gambling (gaming) behavior.The main categories within Disorders due to addictive behaviors are:6C50 - Gambling DisorderGambling disorder is characterized by persistent problematic gambling behavior that leads to significant distress or impairment in personal
column4: and/or social functioning. Exclusions for this diagnosis may include Compulsive Sexual Behavior Disorder (6C72) and Paraphilic Disorders (6D30-6D3Z).Gaming disorder is characterized by a pattern of persistent or recurrent gaming behavior
column5: which becomes so extensive that it takes precedence over other life interests and daily activities. This behavior leads to significant distress or impairment in personal
column7: and/or social functioning. Exclusions for this diagnosis may include Compulsive Sexual Behavior Disorder (6C72) and Paraphilic Disorders ( 6D30-6D3Z).The ICD-11 MMS outlines the following additional categories within Disorders due to addictive behaviors:6C51 - Compulsive Sexual Behavior Disorder (unspecified)This disorder is characterized by recurrent and intense preoccupation with sexual fantasies
column9: or behaviors that lead to significant distress or impairment in personal functioning. The diagnosis does not specify the type of behavior involved. Exclusions for this disorder may include gambling (gaming) disorder and paraphilic disorders.6C52 - Paraphilic Disorders (unspecified)Paraphilic disorders are characterized by intense sexual fantasies
column11: or behaviors that involve non-consenting individuals or cause significant distress to the individual experiencing these feelings. The diagnosis does not specify the type of paraphilia involved. Exclusions for this diagnosis may include gambling (gaming) disorder and compulsive sexual behavior disorder.6C5Y - Other Specified Disorders due to Addictive Behaviors (unspecified)This category includes specified but unidentified disorders related to addictive behaviors that do not fit into the other categories outlined in this section of the ICD-11 MMS. Exclusions for these disorders may include gambling (gaming) disorder
column13: and paraphilic disorders.6C5Z - Disorders due to Addictive Behaviors
column14: Unspecified (unspecified)This category includes unidentified addictive behaviors that do not fit into the other categories outlined in this section of the ICD-11 MMS. Exclusions for these disorders may include gambling (gaming) disorder
